newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal copper strikers, mine director talk-union.
newsitem.headline: Portugal copper strikers, mine director talk-union.

text.p: Miners' leaders are meeting the director of the strike-bound Neves Corvo copper mine in southern Portugal for discussions brokered by the local civil governor, a senior union official said on Tuesday.
But the official could give no details of the talks nor whether they could be interpreted as a sign of progress in ending the two-day stoppage at the mine, Europe's largest copper producer.
Antonio Manuel, a director of the Portuguese miners' union, told Reuters that the talks were being held at the invitation of the civil governor of Beja, Antonio Saleiro.
The southern town of Beja, some 250 km south of Lisbon, is near the mine, which produced 107,000 tonnes of copper in 1996.
A senior union official earlier said output from the Neves Corvo mine was completely halted.
